byline.contributor: Jonathan Gilbert contributed reporting from Buenos Aires, Gaia Pianigiani from Vatican City, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.

abstract: Pope Francis prepares to release his first major encyclical on theme of the environment and the poor, seeking to emphasize moral dimension of global warming and other issues that have largely been debated in secular context; message will be delivered to more than billion Catholics worldwide, and could put church at forefront of nascent coalition between religion and science.
lead_paragraph: When Francis releases his first major teaching letter on the theme of the environment and poverty, he may redefine a secular topic as a matter of morality.

headline.main: Pope Francis to Explore Climate’s Effect on World’s Poor
headline.print_headline: Pope to Explore Climate’s Effect on World’s Poor
